review.title: Credibilistic TOPSIS Model for Evaluation and Selection of Municipal Solid Waste Disposal Methods
review.abstract: Municipal solid waste management (MSWM) is a challenging issue of urban development in developing countries. Each country having different socio-economic-environmental background, might not accept a particular disposal method as the optimal choice. Selection of suitable disposal method in MSWM, under vague and imprecise information can be considered as multi criteria decision making problem (MCDM). In the present paper, TOPSIS (Technique for Order Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution) methodology is extended based on credibility theory for evaluating the performances of MSW disposal methods under some criteria fixed by experts. The proposed model helps decision makers to choose a preferable alternative for their municipal area. A sensitivity analysis by our proposed model confirms this fact.

metadata.title: Credibilistic TOPSIS Model for Evaluation and Selection of Municipal Solid Waste Disposal Methods

sections.text: Municipal Waste Management (MSWM) is a challenging topic in urban development in developing countries. Each country with different socio-economic and ecological backgrounds may not accept a particular disposal method as an optimal choice. Selecting suitable disposal methods in MSWM can be considered a multi-criterion decision problem (MCDM) under vague and imprecise information. In this paper, the TOPSIS method (Technique for Order Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution) is expanded on the basis of a credibility theory to evaluate the performance of MSW disposal methods based on some criteria defined by experts. The proposed model helps decision makers choose a preferred alternative for their urban area. A sensitivity analysis using our proposed model confirms this fact. Keywords: waste disposal; multi-criterion decision making (MCDM); TOPSIS; Fuzzy Numbers; Credibility Theory.
